pr_title: feat(e2e): Add e2e tests for PnP

timeline.bodyText: is there as Device and Module in some other imported package that prevents this from being imported at class level?
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: I moved it to the imports.
replies.author: bikamani

timeline.bodyText: Q - why do we have new TestDevice() here and in TwinPnPTestInstance() constructor as well?
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: Good catch, removed the one from constructor
replies.author: bikamani

timeline.bodyText: Seems like you could also parameterize Device vs Module here
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText:
See here for an example: 
  
    
      azure-iot-sdk-java/iot-e2e-tests/common/src/test/java/tests/integration/com/microsoft/azure/sdk/iot/iothub/setup/SendMessagesCommon.java
    
    
         Line 63
      in
      fc2ed81
    
    
    
    

        
          
           {HTTPS, SAS, ClientType.DEVICE_CLIENT, publicKeyCert, privateKey, x509Thumbprint, false},
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: cool, let me check that.
replies.author: bikamani

replies.bodyText: Also x509 vs SAS authentication. Since those two have pretty different connect flows, it would be worth testing that
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: bikamani

timeline.bodyText: You can move this label up to the class level since all pnp twin tests will be standard tier only
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: That's true I can move it up in this case
replies.author: bikamani

replies.bodyText: @timtay-microsoft  Is there something like this for c# as well?
replies.author: vinagesh

replies.bodyText: Standard vs Basic tier? Not that I know of. C# doesn't test against basic tier hubs
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: No need to set fields to null when you are done with them. Here and below
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: why would you want a dangling object?
replies.author: prmathur-microsoft

replies.bodyText:
http://net-informations.com/java/cjava/objectonull.htm
That doesn't help garbage collection as much as you might think
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: I know you are following the pattern here, but I'd rather this name specified that it is a client. Something like "twinServiceClient" or "twinClient" instead of "sCDeviceTwin"
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: I like that suggestion too. I would follow the same pattern like other tests for less confusion though.
replies.author: bikamani

replies.bodyText: Now would be a good time to rename the other uses of this naming then
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: No need to set this to null
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft
prmathur-microsoft

replies.bodyText: isPullRequest? That value is used when evaluating whether or not to run CI tests
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: not required, removed those
replies.author: bikamani

timeline.bodyText: are we using this for something?
timeline.author: vinagesh

replies.bodyText: not required, removed those
replies.author: bikamani

timeline.bodyText: Can model id come from constant?
timeline.author: prmathur-microsoft

replies.bodyText: sorry didn't get your question.
replies.author: bikamani

replies.bodyText: I'd actually like to see this randomized per test so there is no chance of one test interfering with another
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: Is there a restriction to the version number that would keep you from randomizing?
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: Not sure of restriction but added randomizing
replies.author: bikamani

timeline.bodyText: if basic hub, will none of the tests work?
timeline.author: vinagesh

replies.bodyText:
In basic hub, modules are not supported.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/iot-hub-scaling
replies.author: bikamani
